definition[0]: relating to technology that can be used to measure things such as people’s eyes or fingerprints. These measurements can be kept on computer and then used to check someone’s identity, for example when they show a passport at an airport
example[1]: biometric identifiers such as fingerprints or iris patterns
definition[1]: biometric measurements, for example of someone’s eyes, features, fingerprints, or voice, can be used by machines for identifying who that person is
example[3]: biometric security devices such as finger scanners
